ipi

Class FolderPaths

  • java.lang.Object
    • ipi.FolderPaths

  • public class FolderPaths
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.0 2018-04-01
    Author:
    Paul I Ighofose FolderPaths class provides default file path attributes and retrieves current working directory

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FolderPaths() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String getHTMLFolder()
      Uses getPath to get the current working directory for the application's root path then gets the default folder location for HTML source files
      static java.lang.String getImagesFolder()
      Uses getPath to get the current working directory for the application's root path then gets the default folder location for images source files
      static java.lang.String getLogsFolder()
      Uses getPath to get the current working directory for the application's root path then gets the default folder location for log files
      static java.lang.String getPath()
      When in normal mode uses .getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation().toString() to return the current working directory for the application's root path When in Web Start mode uses Runtime.getRuntime().exec("cmd /c cd") to return the current working directory for the application's root path
      static java.lang.String getTextFolder()
      Uses getPath to get the current working directory for the application's root path then gets the default folder location for text source files
      static java.lang.String getUserTempFolder() 
      static java.lang.String getWebAppsFolder()
      Uses getPath to get the current working directory for the application's root path then gets the default folder location for jar application files

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • FolderPaths

        public FolderPaths()

    • Method Detail

      • getHTMLFolder

        public static java.lang.String getHTMLFolder()
        Uses getPath to get the current working directory for the application's root path then gets the default folder location for HTML source files
        Returns:
        returns the folder location for HTML source files

      • getImagesFolder

        public static java.lang.String getImagesFolder()
        Uses getPath to get the current working directory for the application's root path then gets the default folder location for images source files
        Returns:
        returns the folder location for images source files

        public static java.lang.String getLogsFolder()
        Uses getPath to get the current working directory for the application's root path then gets the default folder location for log files
        Returns:

      • getTextFolder

        public static java.lang.String getTextFolder()
        Uses getPath to get the current working directory for the application's root path then gets the default folder location for text source files
        Returns:
        returns the folder location for text source files

      • getWebAppsFolder

        public static java.lang.String getWebAppsFolder()
        Uses getPath to get the current working directory for the application's root path then gets the default folder location for jar application files
        Returns:
        returns the folder location for jar application files

      • getPath

        public static java.lang.String getPath()
        When in normal mode uses .getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation().toString() to return the current working directory for the application's root path When in Web Start mode uses Runtime.getRuntime().exec("cmd /c cd") to return the current working directory for the application's root path
        Returns:
        returns the current working directory for the application's root path

        public static java.lang.String getUserTempFolder()
